title: Hot Water On Demand Was Revolutionary
description: A fast breakdown of Hot Water On Demand Was Revolutionary for builders.

hook.text: Before 1868, a hot bath meant stove-heating water and carrying it by bucket. Maughan changed that with the gas geyser.

buildup.text: Maughan's 'geyser' used gas to heat water flowing through copper coils. Turn the tap, get hot waterâ€”instantly.

discovery.text: Early geysers had no ventâ€”carbon monoxide killed users. Ruud added a flue and thermostat, making them safe by 1889.

twist.text: The tank heater (1889) replaced instant heating for decadesâ€”slower but cheaper. Tankless returned a century later.

climax.text: Today's tankless heaters are Maughan's geyser perfected: precise, efficient, compact. The idea just needed modern tech.

punchline.text: Hot water on demand: invented, abandoned, reinvented.

quiz.question: What danger did the first gas water heaters pose?
options: Carbon monoxide poisoning from lack of ventilation
